column4: I have an HP DL360G4 with 2x on-board Broadcom NetXtreme BCM5704 NIC's. They're both plugged into good switch ports (i.e. I switched the cables a few times). However when I run ethtool on them eth1 has link and sets duplex/link speed whereas eth0 has no link and duplex/speed are undetermined. Any idea why this would be happening?
does lspci -v show the two devices as the same hardware?
same PCI IDs and everything?
ok, that's a good sign. :-)
sudo ifconfig eth0 up
sudo ifconfig eth1 up
Yes, I've had the server out of the rack on my desk a few days.
hmm. If you go on the premise that you have to make it as simple as possible, then you should eliminate the switch and try a crossover cable.
eth0 goes into the same switch..
I can even plug eth0's cable into wth1 and it still works.
so one port is happy, one isn't at all?
Yes, exactly.
Yet as I said I've gone through three replacement system boards, I eventually had HP swap the entire chassis. I've had the same issue with all of them.
as a sanity check, have you tried booting something like knoppix?
It was a RHEL 3 system.. I installed ubuntu 6.06 just to see if it was osmething weird I fubard..
Exact same output as RHEL.
2 CPUs? or one?
Yep, 2x 3.6GHz Xeon's.
Hmm..
We've got probably ~200 servers up with various OSes and the best supported nics we've found are the Intel E1000's with the NForce ethernet a close second.
It might not be so well supported after all
